item.text: Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H13548)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.(text: CR H13548)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 122.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H13548-13549)
Mr. Wynn moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Environment and Hazardous Materials.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E813)

item.fullName: Del. Faleomavaega, Eni F. H. [D-AS-At Large]

summary.text:
Expresses support for the goal and mission of America Recycles Day.

Encourages all Americans to participate in promoting the social, environmental, and economic benefits of recycling and buying recycled-content products.

Expresses support for the goal and mission of America Recycles Day.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
